title: Culture: Events (Usefulness 1-5)
description: Traveler usefulness 1-5/10 phrases for the Events subcategory within Culture. Includes 5 card(s).

cards.english: My coming-of-age ceremony is next year.
In a traditional Shinto-style Japanese wedding ceremony, the bride and groom share sake as proof of their bond.
cards.romaji: Shinzen kekkonshiki de wa, katame no shirushi to shite shinr shimpu ga nihonshu o nomimasu.
cards.japanese: 神前結婚式では、固めの印として新郎新婦が日本酒を飲みます。

cards.english: When there's a festival, fireworks are often also set off.
cards.romaji: Matsuri ga aru toki wa, yoku hanabi mo ageraremasu.
cards.japanese: 祭りがあるときは、よく花火も上げられます。

cards.english: At the first visit to the shrine of the year, people buy lucky charms and protective charms for the coming year and return those from the past year.
cards.romaji: Hatsum de de wa omamori o kai, furui omamori o kaeshimasu.
cards.japanese: 初詣ではお守りを買い、古いお守りを返します。

cards.english: Obon is a period of honoring one's ancestors, so it's important to clean the family graves before welcoming their spirits.
cards.romaji: O-bon wa sosen o matsuru kikan na no de, sosen no rei o mukaeru mae ni o-haka o s ji suru no wa taisetsu na koto desu.
cards.japanese: お盆は祖先を祭る期間なので、祖先の霊を迎える前にお墓を掃除するのは大切なことです。
